intro: Ptilotrichum lapeyrouseanum subsp. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ptilotrichum, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
